mjw297

Class LexerException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • mjw297.LexerException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class LexerException
extends java.lang.Exception
    A LexerException is an exception that occurs during lexing. For example, unterminated string literals, invalid integer literals, and invalid escape characters would all throw LexerExceptions. Each LexerException is accompanied by the row and column where the lexing exception originated as well as a detailed error message explaining the error. These exceptions can be caught by the main xic program and pretty printed.
    See Also:
